definition: to take complete charge (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Bao
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass

sentences.english: Music Association book be able to how Taibaodalan all of the collection?
sentences.chinese: 音著协怎么能大包大揽全部收缴？

sentences.english: The U.S. government subsidizes most of it, which hides the true costs.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府对其大包大揽的补助掩盖了其真正的开销。

sentences.english: We no longer need to frame the question, do all the research and write all the papers.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不需要大包大揽地开展研究和编写论文了。

sentences.english: Before, the government wanted to do everything itself.
sentences.chinese: 以前，政府总想大包大揽。

definition: lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to undertake to do everything by oneself/to run the whole show
to do everything oneself (idiom); not to allow others in on the act
to delegate power/to decentralize
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to attend to everything personally
to do sth oneself
see 作主[zuo4 zhu3]
lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
lit. things are not separated according to their size (idiom)/fig. to deal with any matter, regardless of its importance
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass
to do sth in place of sb else
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
